content: My @bors try build just failed after running for ~1 hour because an intra-doc link in rustdoc's API docs (i.e., /nightly/nightly-rustc/rustdoc docs) failed to resolve. Given that @bors try doesn't run tests, is there a reason it builds the compiler docs?
It seems like not building compiler docs as part of @bors try would both be more consistent and reduce try build times.

try does a normal dist build of what is usually published on nightly. The Docker image is defined to build with compiler-docs (since those normally get published). It might be possible, though quite awkward to pass that in as a configuration to the docker image.
I would prefer to keep try and auto-branch builds equivalent
Ah, I think I assumed that x.py dist ran tests so @bors try must be doing something else.
